explanations.machine learning: The paper proposes a neural entity linking model (JEL) which is a machine learning approach to link mentions in textual sources to entities in a knowledge graph.
explanations.deep learning: The paper mentions the use of a 'Wide & Deep Learning model', which is a deep learning technique, to match character and semantic information.
explanations.neural network: The proposed JEL model is an end-to-end neural entity linking model, indicating the use of neural networks.
explanations.representation learning: The model generates entity embeddings, which is a form of representation learning.
explanations.backpropagation: Neural networks typically use backpropagation for training, though it is not explicitly mentioned, it is implied.
explanations.hidden layer: Neural networks usually consist of hidden layers, though not explicitly mentioned, it is implied in the architecture.
explanations.Wide & Deep Learning model: The paper explicitly mentions using a Wide & Deep Learning model for matching character and semantic information.
